programme.desc: On Halloween night, a group of notorious serial killers escape from an asylum and terrorize the patrons of a funhouse carnival - leaving only a rag-tag bunch of kids, a clueless deputy and a local sheriff to stop the carnage.(n)

programme.title: TIFFANY HADDISH: SHE READY! From the Hood to Hollywood!
programme.desc: In this hour-long special filmed at the Nate Holden Performing Arts Center, rising comedy star Tiffany Haddish takes the stage in her hometown of Los Angeles to tackle subjects ranging from her early days in foster care and being bullied on the playground, to getting her revenge on ex-boyfriends and introducing Will and Jada Pinkett Smith to Groupon.(n)

programme.title: All-Stars
programme.desc: Comedy about a veteran softball coach, who is saddled with a team of inexperienced 10-year-old girls and their overly ambitious, delusional parents.(n)

programme.title: Rescue Dogs
programme.desc: Family adventure set on a beach in sunny southern California, in which a restaurant owner enlists his rescue dog to take on an evil businessman and finds time to fall for a beautiful dancer.(n)

programme.title: Dudes & Dragons
programme.desc: When a powerful wizard is jilted by a princess, he vows to rid the land of love and commands a fire breathing dragon to destroy any sign of affection seen throughout the kingdom but as the death toll rises, a brave and arrogant warrior and his estranged brother answer the princess’ call to fight the curse.(n)

programme.title: The Art of the Steal
programme.desc: This eye-opening documentary tells the story of the Barnes Collection, $25 billion worth of masterpieces by Cezanne, Matisse and Renoir that has become the focus of a culture war between those who wish to preserve the intentions of the collection's original owner, and a conspiracy of politically powerful corporations seeking to profit by seizing and relocating the artwork.(n)

programme.title: The Harvest
programme.desc: A couple who keeps their sick son in a secluded environment find their controlled lives challenged by a young girl who moves in next door. The perfect family is not who they appear to be. Starring Michael Shannon.(n)

programme.title: Bad Girl
programme.desc: Amy must fight to save her adoptive parents from their self-styled vengeful blood daughter, Chloe.(n)

programme.title: Pretty Persuasion
programme.desc: When high school student Kimberly Joyce accuses her English teacher of sexual harassment, she turns her exclusive Beverly Hills private school, and everything else in her wake, upside down. Hell hath no fury like a teenager scorned.(n)

programme.title: Don't Sleep
programme.desc: Shawn and Zach are young lovers who move into a guesthouse together on an estate owned by Mr. and Mrs. Marino. When bizarre events begin to occur, Zach slowly remembers a forgotten time in his childhood when he suffered from severe and violent psychosis - memories erased by a series of electroconvulsive shock treatments administered by his psychiatrist. As the terrors surrounding their lives grow to deadly proportions, Zach is forced to question his own sanity.(n)

programme.title: Shot
programme.desc: Three lives are irrevocably changed when a gun is accidentally fired on a busy LA street. Mark (Noah Wyle) and Phoebe (Sharon Leal) are in the midst of a breakup. Miguel (Jorge Lendeborg, Jr.), a bullied teenager, is given an illegal gun by his cousin for protection. As Miguel handles it, the gun accidently fires and Mark is hit by the bullet.(n)

programme.title: Giant
programme.desc: Best Picture based on the Edna Ferber bestseller about Texas cattlemen, oil, troubled romances and racial injustice chronicles the lives of one proud family from the 1930s to the '50s. James Dean's final film; George Stevens won a Best Director Oscar.

programme.title: Cimarron
programme.desc: Frontier epic based on Edna Ferber's best seller covers the years 1890 to 1915 and chronicles how an impulsive and short-fused cowboy and his savvy immigrant wife were instrumental in the settling of the Oklahoma territory.

programme.title: In Cold Blood
programme.desc: Adaptation of Truman Capote's fact-based crime novel about two drifters who attempt to rob a farmhouse and end up murdering a rural family. Richard Brooks was nominated for Best Director and his script was nominated for Best Adapted Screenplay.

programme.title: Boys Town
programme.desc: A fact-based portrait of Father Edward J. Flanagan, a crusading priest who built a Nebraska community for orphans and believed that "there's no such thing as a bad boy," although his theory is sorely tested by a punky street tough who learns the hard way about the school's altruistic mission. Spencer Tracy's portrayal of the famous founding father won him his second consecutive Oscar (the first was for "Captains Courageous"). Best Picture nominee. (cc).

programme.title: Rockabye
programme.desc: Constance Bennett plays a stage star who wants to adopt a child.

programme.title: Our Betters
programme.desc: Somerset Maugham's play satirizing immorality among Britain's upper classes.

programme.title: Dinner at Eight
programme.desc: The Kaufman-Ferber Broadway hit makes for a trenchant character study of a cross-section of elegant New York society types invited to a swank dinner party where the menu includes scandal, suicide, adultery, business chicanery and romance.

programme.title: David Copperfield
programme.desc: Best Picture nominee adapts Charles Dickens' 1849 tale of an English orphan's adventurous life and the colorful characters he meets along the way as he comes of age, becomes a successful novelist and ultimately finds the true love of his life. Two actors portray the title character, Freddie Bartholomew as the impoverished youth and Frank Lawton as the grown-up author.

programme.title: Sylvia Scarlett
programme.desc: A young woman steals some expensive lace and hopes to smuggle it from France to England with her father. To elude police, she cuts her hair short and disguises herself as a man.

programme.title: Romeo and Juliet
programme.desc: Best Picture nominee, based on the Shakespeare classic, follows two star-crossed young lovers from feuding families who hope their forbidden union will help heal the rift between their clans, but ultimately face certain tragedy.

programme.title: Camille
programme.desc: A stately but sickly Paris courtesan is swept off her feet by an equally enamored diplomat, but she leaves him to protect his career, only to later be reunited with him---briefly and tragically.

programme.title: Badlands
programme.desc: Fact-based tale of a 15-year-old and her 25-year-old boyfriend who embark on a killing spree in the Dakota badlands of 1958.

programme.title: The Purchase Price
programme.desc: A cafe singer becomes a farmer's mail-order bride.

programme.title: A River Runs Through It
programme.desc: A memoir of two very different brothers---one reserved, the other a hell-raiser---angling for the attention of their preacher father, who uses fly-fishing as a metaphor to teach his Cain and Abel offspring about life in early 20th-century Montana. (cc).

programme.title: Spencer's Mountain
programme.desc: A Wyoming couple struggle to raise their nine children amid the natural splendors and financial hard times of the rural Grand Tetons.

programme.title: The Unsinkable Molly Brown

programme.title: Modern Times
programme.desc: Famously choosing to make the film silent well after the age of talkies had begun, Charlie Chaplin used intermittent sound effects to tell this story of The Tramp coping with the industrial age, with the help of an orphan girl he befriends along the way.

programme.title: Strike

programme.title: Wanda

programme.title: Tyler Perry's Meet the Browns
programme.desc: A lively but surly fellow named LeRoy Brown (David Mann) attempts to open and operate a retirement home in this sitcom spun off from "Tyler Perry's House of Payne." First up: Brown gets help in his venture from a doctor (Lamman Rucker), the doc's nurse wife (Denise Boutte) and a social worker (Jeannette Sousa). Brown's residents include a gruff ex-marine (Tony Vaughn) and an aging B-movie actress (K Callan). LaVan Davis guest stars. Created by Perry, who also directed and executive produced. (repeat).

programme.title: Tyler Perry's Meet the Browns

programme.title: My Wife and Kids
programme.desc: Lou Rawls guest stars in an episode that takes a lighthearted look at a serious problem: colon cancer. programme.title: Polska noc
programme.desc: Dla tych, którzy twierdzą, że w telewizjach muzycznych i radiach pojawia się za mało polskiej muzyki, Eska TV proponuje program "Polska noc". To całonocne pasmo zarezerwowane jest dla krajowych wykonawców.

programme.title: Polska noc
programme.desc: Dla tych, którzy twierdzą, że w telewizjach muzycznych i radiach pojawia się za mało polskiej muzyki, Eska TV proponuje program "Polska noc". To całonocne pasmo zarezerwowane jest dla krajowych wykonawców.

programme.title: Zranione uczucia
programme.desc: Mała Rita (Mel Maia) w dramatycznych okolicznościach traci ojca. Bezwzględna macocha (Adriana Esteves) i jej przyjaciel porzucają ją na wysypisku śmieci, gdzie musi walczyć o przetrwanie. Tam nawiązuje liczne przyjaźnie i odnajduje miłość swojego życia. Wkrótce zostaje adoptowana przez małżeństwo z Argentyny. Po wielu latach już dorosła Rita (Débora Falabella), pod imieniem Nina, wraca w rodzinne strony, by zemścić się za krzywdy z przeszłości.

programme.title: Zranione uczucia
programme.desc: Mała Rita (Mel Maia) w dramatycznych okolicznościach traci ojca. Bezwzględna macocha (Adriana Esteves) i jej przyjaciel porzucają ją na wysypisku śmieci, gdzie musi walczyć o przetrwanie. Tam nawiązuje liczne przyjaźnie i odnajduje miłość swojego życia. Wkrótce zostaje adoptowana przez małżeństwo z Argentyny. Po wielu latach już dorosła Rita (Débora Falabella), pod imieniem Nina, wraca w rodzinne strony, by zemścić się za krzywdy z przeszłości.

programme.title: Dzień dobry
programme.desc: Poranne pasmo muzyczne, w którym prezentowane są najlepsze teledyski artystów cieszących się dużą popularnością.

programme.title: Eska On The Beach
programme.desc: Wakacyjny program Eski TV nadawany prosto z najpiękniejszych plaż. Ola Kot zaprezentuje widzom wiele ciekawostek, a wśród nich najnowsze plotki, porady modowe oraz wieści muzyczne z kraju i ze świata. Nie zabraknie najnowszych piosenek i teledysków. Widzowie przekonają się, który utwór zasłuży sobie na miano hitu lata.

programme.title: 10 hitów 1 po 2
programme.desc: Twórcy programu w każdym wydaniu prezentują 10 wybranych hitów. Utwory, będące największymi przebojami najsłynniejszych wykonawców, grane są jeden po drugim.

programme.title: Projekt Kamper
programme.desc: Filip Rudanacja zamienia swojego garbusa na atrakcyjnego kampera i wyrusza na wakacyjną wyprawę. Prowadzący oddaje się paradzie letnich wyzwań. Wypoczywa, szuka dobrej zabawy przy dźwiękach najlepszej muzyki i robi rzeczy, które każdy powinien wykonać podczas urlopu, jak zjedzenie gofra, czy rozstawienie parawanu.

programme.title: Zranione uczucia
programme.desc: Mała Rita (Mel Maia) w dramatycznych okolicznościach traci ojca. Bezwzględna macocha (Adriana Esteves) i jej przyjaciel porzucają ją na wysypisku śmieci, gdzie musi walczyć o przetrwanie. Tam nawiązuje liczne przyjaźnie i odnajduje miłość swojego życia. Wkrótce zostaje adoptowana przez małżeństwo z Argentyny. Po wielu latach już dorosła Rita (Débora Falabella), pod imieniem Nina, wraca w rodzinne strony, by zemścić się za krzywdy z przeszłości.(n)

Ola Kot zaprezentuje widzom wiele ciekawostek, a wśród nich najnowsze plotki, porady modowe oraz wieści muzyczne z kraju i ze świata. Nie zabraknie najnowszych piosenek i teledysków. Widzowie przekonają się, który utwór zasłuży sobie na miano hitu lata.(n)

programme.title: Projekt Kamper
programme.desc: Filip Rudanacja zamienia swojego garbusa na atrakcyjnego kampera i wyrusza na wakacyjną wyprawę. Prowadzący oddaje się paradzie letnich wyzwań. Wypoczywa, szuka dobrej zabawy przy dźwiękach najlepszej muzyki i robi rzeczy, które każdy powinien wykonać podczas urlopu, jak zjedzenie gofra, czy rozstawienie parawanu.

programme.title: Zranione uczucia
programme.desc: Mała Rita (Mel Maia) w dramatycznych okolicznościach traci ojca. Bezwzględna macocha (Adriana Esteves) i jej przyjaciel porzucają ją na wysypisku śmieci, gdzie musi walczyć o przetrwanie. Tam nawiązuje liczne przyjaźnie i odnajduje miłość swojego życia. Wkrótce zostaje adoptowana przez małżeństwo z Argentyny. Po wielu latach już dorosła Rita (Débora Falabella), pod imieniem Nina, wraca w rodzinne strony, by zemścić się za krzywdy z przeszłości.(n)

Ola Kot zaprezentuje widzom wiele ciekawostek, a wśród nich najnowsze plotki, porady modowe oraz wieści muzyczne z kraju i ze świata. Nie zabraknie najnowszych piosenek i teledysków. Widzowie przekonają się, który utwór zasłuży sobie na miano hitu lata.(n)

programme.title: Double Dare *
programme.sub-title: Comeback Kids vs. Red Hot Cocoa
programme.desc: A couple of familiar faces come back for redemption after appearing on the show decades ago. It's a close game throughout, but only one team will get a second chance at the obstacle course. (cc).

programme.title: SpongeBob SquarePants
programme.desc: SpongeBob mistakes an escaped con for his driving teacher, and the new instructor learns a lesson; SpongeBob gets lost in the lost and found while searching for a missing toy. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: The SpongeBob SquarePants Movie
programme.desc: The first big-screen adventure of the popular children's (and adults') cartoon series follows SpongeBob as he sets out to retrieve King Neptune's stolen crown, save Mr. Krabs, who has been accused of the theft, and stymie Plankton and his plot for world domination. (repeat).

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Chandler sees Rachel naked; Joey learns his father is having an affair; Phoebe dates a psychiatrist. Gloria: Brenda Vaccaro. Roger: Fisher Stevens. Joey Sr.: Robert Costanzo. Ronni: Lee Garlington. (repeat).

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One with the Stoned Guy
programme.desc: Chandler and Monica plan big career moves, while Ross labors to hit it off with a date. Steve: Jon Lovitz. Celia: Melora Hardin. Ms. Tedlock: Fritzi Burr. Chandler: Matthew Perry. Monica: Courteney Cox. Ross: David Schwimmer. (repeat).

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Part 1 of two. Ross attends Lamaze classes; Joey dates Phoebe's twin; and Chandler has the hots for a co-worker he's supposed to fire. Jamie: Helen Hunt. Fran: Leila Kenzle. Nina: Jennifer Grant. (repeat).

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Conclusion. Monica and Rachel meet two cute doctors; Ross looks to Jack for fatherly advice; Phoebe confronts her twin about Joey. Jack: Elliot Gould. Admissions Woman: Alaina Reed Hall. Monica: Courteney Cox. (repeat).

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One with All the Poker
programme.desc: The guys let the ladies in on a sacred ritual---their poker game. Meanwhile, Rachel has an interview with Saks. Aunt Iris: Beverly Garland. Ross: David Schwimmer. Monica: Courteney Cox. (repeat).

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One Where the Monkey Gets Away
programme.desc: Ross entrusts Rachel with his pet monkey for a day; Barry has a surprise for Rachel. Barry: Mitchell Whitfield. Luisa: Megan Cavanagh. Rachel: Jennifer Aniston. (repeat).

programme.title: Mom
programme.sub-title: A Cricket and a Hedge Made of Gold
programme.desc: Marjorie takes a break from the group, so Bonnie becomes the go-to person for everyone's problems. Also, Christy faces a painful memory from her past. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Mom
programme.sub-title: A Few Thongs and a Hawaiian Funeral
programme.desc: Christy and Jill take Emily to see her biological mother in rehab, and make a surprising discovery. Meanwhile, Bonnie watches Adam's dog while he is out of town. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Mom
programme.desc: Season 4 ends with Bonnie getting into trouble with the IRS. Christy tries to help her but soon realizes she is in over her head, so she suggests Bonnie seek help from her newfound brother, Ray. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Mom
programme.desc: Newly sober single mom Christy is challenged when her estranged, overly critical mother returns to her life in the series premiere of this comedy from executive producer Chuck Lorre ("Two and a Half Men" and "The Big Bang Theory"). (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: George Lopez
programme.desc: Benny urges George to spy on Carmen when she brings a boy home for the first time. Duncan: Jonathan Jones. Jessica: Paige Segal. Carmen: Masiela Lusha. Benny: Belita Moreno. Angie: Constance Marie. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: George Lopez
programme.desc: Co-executive producer Sandra Bullock plays an accident-prone worker in an episode about George's distaste for birthday parties. Benny: Belita Moreno. Angie: Constance Marie. Max: Luis Garcia. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.desc: In the Season 2 finale, Beverly and Murray prepare to say farewell to Erica for the summer after she's accepted to a 10-week arts program; and Barry takes the risky job of school mascot to be closer to Lainey. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.desc: In the Season 3 premiere, Erica and Barry help Lainey plan a big house party inspired by the movie "Risky Business" while her dad is out of town. However, it's Beverly who comes to the rescue when things get out of hand. Meanwhile, Murray grows annoyed with how much time Adam is spending on the phone with Dana, who he struggles to stay in touch with now that she has moved away. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: SpongeBob SquarePants
programme.desc: A “bad” word becomes part of SpongeBob's vocabulary. Later, the excitable sea sponge frees his creative spirit under Squidward's guidance. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: SpongeBob SquarePants
programme.desc: SpongeBob's lightweight appearance prevents him from entering the toughest club in Bikini Bottom; and Squidward brags to a former school rival that he owns a five-star restaurant. Voices include...Squilliam: Dee Bradley Baker. Reg: Tom Wilson. Doctor Fish: Carlos Alazraqui. Tom: Mr. Lawrence. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Paw Patrol
programme.sub-title: Pups Save the Mail; Pups Save a Frog Mayor
programme.desc: Tracker has a special surprise coming in the mail for Carlos; and Rubble dreams that Mayor Goodway turned into a frog. (repeat).

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.sub-title: Bubbles; Emily Elephant; Polly's Holiday; Teddy's Day Out; Mysteries
programme.desc: Daddy Pig demonstrates how to make huge bubbles; Peppa befriends an elephant who's new to her playgroup. (repeat).

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.sub-title: The Cycle Ride; Dens; Zoë Zebra the Postman's Daughter; Cuckoo Clock; Ice Skating
programme.desc: Peppa goes on a bicycle ride with her family; the girls and boys play in separate tree houses; Zoë Zebra invites Peppa and George to her birthday party; Daddy Pig fixes an old cuckoo clock; Peppa learns how to ice skate. (repeat).

programme.title: Bubble Guppies
programme.desc: Gil needs to get a haircut before picture day, but he visits the hair salon on a very crowded day. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Bubble Guppies
programme.desc: The kids help a rhinoceros find a friend as they learn about zoo habitats. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Paw Patrol
programme.sub-title: Pups Save a Robosaurus; Pups Save a Film Festival
programme.desc: A robotic dino comes to life, and the pups must find it and return it to its home; the pups make a movie for a film festival, but their hard work is halted by Daring Danny X's outrageous stunt. (repeat).

programme.title: Paw Patrol
programme.desc: Sid Swashbuckle the Pirate and his first pup mate, Arrby, steal the giant pearl-making shell that gives Puplantis its magic. (repeat).

programme.title: Paw Patrol
programme.sub-title: Sea Patrol: Pups Save the Sunken Sloop; Sea Patrol: Pups Save a Wiggly Whale
programme.desc: Sid the Pirate and Arrby have taken the sunken sloop; and a wiggling whale has knocked the diving bell to he bottom of the ocean, with Cap'n Turbot and Francois inside. (repeat).

programme.title: Paw Patrol
programme.sub-title: Sea Patrol: Pups Save Tilly Turbot; Pups Save an Upset Elephant
programme.desc: The Paw Patrol must rescue Cap'n Turbot and Francois' Grandma Tilly after she rides off on a dolphin; Carlos and Tracker call the Paw Patrol to help solve the mystery of a rumbling sound that's upsetting the jungle elephants. (repeat).

programme.title: Paw Patrol
programme.sub-title: Pups Save a Blimp; Pups Save a Chili Cook-Out
programme.desc: In the fourth-season opener, a weather blimp is stolen by Mayor Humdinger, who wants to use it to alter Foggy Bottom's weather. Later, Mr. Porter's stove explodes prior to the big chili cook-off. (repeat).

programme.title: Paw Patrol
programme.sub-title: Pups Save the Sea Turtles; Pup and the Very Big Baby
programme.desc: Ryder, Chase and Rubble help baby sea turtle cross a road to get to the beach; a young beached whale needs to be reunited with its mom. (repeat).

programme.title: Paw Patrol
programme.desc: The gang turn into Mer-Pups in order to rescue their new pals who live in the ocean. (repeat).

programme.title: SpongeBob SquarePants
programme.desc: Plankton opens a coliseum with a free gladiator show after demolishing the Chum Bucket; Squidward tries to compose a song for a symphony contest but is interrupted by the antics of SpongeBob and Patrick. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: SpongeBob SquarePants

programme.desc: Jas becomes ill and Lily is offered her part in a scene from Romeo and Juliet for the school assembly. Martha causes upset when she washes a particular teddy bear.(n)

programme.title: So Awkward
programme.desc: Jas creates some software to assess compatibility in potential partners, and while Lily is delighted to discover that she and Matt are 97 per cent soulmates, Martha is horrified to discover her ideal mate is Ollie.(n)

programme.title: So Awkward
programme.desc: Jas is overjoyed to hear the girls have won their campaign for a new school library - until she is told her favourite tree will have to be chopped down to make way for the building.(n)

programme.title: So Awkward
programme.desc: When Lily is upset to realise Matt is going out with cool girl Greta Masters, Jas plans a make-over slumber party to cheer her up. Unfortunately it clashes with a rare comet sighting, which Martha and Ollie are desperate to experience. They have even been allowed to borrow the very precious school telescope for the evening. Ollie is smuggled in to Lily's house by Martha to watch secretly from the attic, with Martha planning to split her time between both events. After much chaos and confusion, and with the presence of Ollie in the house rumbled, a compromise is finally reached, where the girls all get to do both the make-over and watch the rare comet. At the end of the make-over session Martha and Jas are horrified to see Lily has transformed herself to look exactly like Greta in a bid to impress Matt. To spare Lily's feelings they pretend to like her new look, but are relieved the next day in school to see Lily returned to her normal, natural self. Lily has realised it's better to be yourself, rather than try and change who you are just to please others.(n)
